parts: how do i set the default namespace for kubectl?
flattened: how do i set the default namespace for kubectl?

parts:
To set the default namespace for `kubectl` so you don’t have to specify `-n <namespace>` every time, you can do one of the following:

### Method 1: Set the default namespace in your current context

Run this command to update your current Kubernetes context to use a specific namespace by default:

```bash
kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=<namespace>
```

Replace `<namespace>` with the name of your desired namespace.

Example:

```bash
kubectl config set-context --current --namespace=dev
```

After this, all `kubectl` commands will use the `dev` namespace unless you override it with `-n`.

---

### Method 2: Set the namespace for a specific context

If you want to set the namespace for a specific context (not necessarily the current one):

```bash
kubectl config set-context <context-name> --namespace=<namespace>
```

Example:

```bash
kubectl config set-context my-cluster-context --namespace=prod
```

---

### Verify your current namespace

To check which namespace is currently set for your context:

```bash
kubectl config view --minify --output 'jsonpath={..namespace}'
```

If it returns empty, it means the default namespace (`default`) is used.

---
